ratings.comment: Dry lecture style, especially compared to some other profs. Hard to stay engaged. Maurice didn't really go above and beyond in any way, just explained the material as it is. Tests are worth almost your whole grade, but course is structured in a way that if you go to discussion, do the homework, and seek help when you need it, you should be fine.

Professor has a clear and concise (but dry) way of explaining material in lecture, but this is a quick moving class. Attend office hours or MLC for all the matters you are unclear about because he's great at answering specific problems. Three tests are 87% of your grade with a max. ~1% curve so study well in advance because it's unforgiving.

Although he was really nice and was happy to answer questions (which I appreciated), I will say that the lectures were very boring and structured weirdly. Very hard not to fall asleep. And very much a tough grader. Unfortunate how well I did on midterms, only for test anxiety to take the best out of me on the final and for my entire grade to fall.

Fabien was great! Math 222 was a hard class in general, but he did a great job explaining even the toughest concepts. He went through the content slowly to make it easier to keep up and understand. 
I would highly recommend him!

Worst thing was prof. Fabien has classes in the early hours and I kept falling asleep. The lectures are so dull and cover everything in the syllabus in too much detail. I had to learn everything from the book because I'm bored and have ADHD. I want lectures that do not need work outside of lecture.

Exams are like the whole grade. If you mess up little stuff they take points off. On the final for one problem I got the right answer but they took points away since I didn't write down how I did it. He goes over too much content. He says things like 'this is important' or 'this is fair game for the exam' but he is boring so I can't pay attention.

I didn't go to class often because I took AP calc. Compared to my other professors, he answers emails, piazza, web assign, and canvas posts super fast. He answers questions in class. Let us drop 4 quiz and 4 homework assignments NO QUESTIONS ASKED. His teaching is meh and I won't elaborate on this point because everyone knows.

"Aiight guys welcome back".  Final exam was so cooked. Lectures were unremarkable...it is what it is...math is dumb. How you gonna make converged series fractions exciting? Cool guy, but 90% of the class is exams. Only thing to do is trust in the curve.

You want a easy A? Do not take him. The lectures that he gives are boring, extremely fast paced and basic, but the tests are very specific and extremely hard. Like, in class he doesn't do the problems that are on the tests. I asked him how to get a better grade and he said I have to do all the practice tests.

Very nice guy when you talk to him, although a little intense. I failed the final and still passed the class. Talk to him about exam regrades. He takes the time to go through the exam with you, making it a really great experience to understand your mistakes and improve for the future. He always had time to meet with me.

Looking back, I regret not trying harder. Now that I know better, I wish all my professors were like him. I slept through lectures, skipped office hours, and didn't do well—not because of Prof. Fabien, but because I didn't try or care at all. His lecture notes are incredibly detailed, with clear, step-by-step instructions to help you succeed.

On the day of the final I forgot I had to take the final. Pulled an all-nighter and overslept. I checked my phone and panicked yet he let me take the make up final. His willingness to let me take the makeup exam is, wow.

To understand third dimensional shapes he used some crazy computer display to rotate 3D geometry in space, which was interesting I guess. The first and last half of the term I only understood what was going on. When we got to infinite power sequencing I was completely lost. Vectors made more sense to me

Don't take this professor. The class was not easy enough. He expects you to read the textbook and read terrible powerpoints after lecture is over. He did not allow ti 84 on exams, note cards orcheat sheets. His voice is mid and he tells you everything that you need to know and the work is too much. I spent too much time learning.
I lied about the reason I missed the final and he let me take it later. My econ101 prof. called my bluff.

He wants you to succeed and makes sure you are aware of all the rules. You can't learn everything by going to lecture; it is just a fact, doesn't matter who is teaching. My other classes have professors missing lecture and having substitutes. On the other hand, Fabien was at EVERY single lecture ON TIME, not one day missed. Ask if you need help.

His lectures are organized, clear, informative, and engaging. Everything I learned helped me pass and prepared me for calculus 3. All his piazza responses are well crafted and thought out. I'd say he spends at least 4 hours every day helping students on piazza. If something isn't clear in lecture you ask him, go to office hours or the TA sections.

At UW-Madison, you're not going to get a better math Professor.  Both midterms were very reasonable, but the final was cooked. I took him for 222. The math department is rough with lots of smart mathematicians that suck at lecturing and grading. He explains the material well. 222 has so much work, but Maurice is a darn good math prof.

I stopped going to class because it was boring but then I failed the first midterm. After that I started going to class and completing all the tasks and studying. I was able to get a decent grade. Take this class only if you want to learn a lot. Most of the work is not during lecture. 222 is nothing like highschool.  222 won't be easy.

The only thing I did not enjoy was when he looks at the slides he points to what he is talking about. And he looks at the ipad when he writes, like he is just looking at what he is writing.  When he writing he sometimes stops and looks in the audience then asks if anything is confusing, and answers questions. That gives me anxiety.

He might come off as very serious, but he goes out of his way to help when you reach out. If you're looking for a professor who smiles and puts on a show, he's not the one for you. He is all about the math, no memes, no jokes, no nonsense. I realized after the second test, to do well in math 222 you have to focus like he does.

Can't complain about anything. Definitely recommend taking him. Few say he's boring, but let's be real, the math department is notorious for bad teaching and he's a solid choice, way better than what you could be getting. It took me a while to understand that lectures are meant to give the basic ideas. TAs are supposed to do more complex examples.

The lectures are organized, and he posts slides before each class. Some say he is boring, but the class was right after lunch and I've got math anxiety-I can't blame him for my struggles. Class engagement was low since cramming over 300 students into a room that feels like a dungeon doesn't exactly set the stage for woke interaction. Not his fault

Prof. Fabien clearly has a passion for teaching and helping students. After lecture, he'd stay an hour answering my questions. Then on Piazza, he's there all day, every single day. For real-ALL day. Total commitment!! He's truly dedicated and genuinely wants you to succeed, putting in the effort to make it happen. He answered my emails at 3 am.

I skipped most of the lectures because they were early and he just talks about math. I tried the homework before it was due and there are problems that the lecture didn't go over. He just reads from his notes, and doesn't have them memorized so he is constantly glancing at them. I didn't do well because the class is way too hard for no reason.

For anybody had to/might retake 222: you're not dumb. It's a hard class. This is the second time I took math 222. Prof. Fab knows his stuff. I asked him for study tips and he gave me so much help. Dude is chill and beyond fair. This is a weed out class. You have to work really hard.

Maurice is incredible! Super helpful, professional and responsive. Anyone have issues with professors not responding to emails or Piazza? Not Maurice. He gives extremely details responses on Piazza and during office hours. He might come off as intimidating at first, but he's actually super approachable once you get to know him.  Absolute legend
The best Prof ever. I wish he taught all my courses. BRO, he boring, but you gotta show up to lectures everything you need to know is talked about
Easy. I 'd love to take other courses from him but they teaches one undegrad course though.

The class was challenging yet fair. Honestly, Dr. Fabien's delivery is pretty monotone, which can make it tough to stay engaged. At the same time, 715 comes with a long list of prerequisites, making it a tough before you even begin. I have mixed feelings with both pros and cons. If you want to learn, take his class. Don't be afraid to ask questions

Overall, GOAT status.  I wanted to learn about FEM, but professor Fabien puts this at the end of the course.  matlab review is a joke. Assignments are strictly take-home; no in-class pressure.  Be prepared to learn tons of material. His approach is very much 'you reap what you sow'—the more effort you invest, the more you'll gain

Calc 2 is a beast. Dr. Fabien makes the learning experience genuinely enjoyable. He reads from slides a lot you gotta review them

I sat in on a class from another professor - let's just say it didn't even come close

He explains examples thoroughly so you can get an idea of what is happening for the most part. He does talk in a very monotone voice, and that is hard for some people to listen too. 90% of your grade is exams, but most of the content on exams isn't more difficult than problems done in lecture or discussion. Your TA matters!!
Lectures aren't very useful as he basically just reads off the provided slides.  Class is very exam heavy (90%).

I liked him fine as a lecturer, but his homework and organization style was very inconsistent. He spent a lot of time on topics from 714 and 513, instead of the bulk of the content being on 715. In particular, FEA was not given enough attention and the material was crammed in 2 weeks. We also did not need time on learning how to code in MATLAB.
Great Professor. Very helpful during office hours because he explains things well. His grading standards are clear and you learn a lot.

Fabien is a very smart man and is clearly evident when giving lectures. Only complaint I have is that the lectures were sometimes a bore and went off on tangents. Homework was hard at times, but there wasn't much of it, maybe 3-4 hours of outside work a week. Exams on the other hand were easy and mimiced the practice exams greatly.

Fabien is very smart and seems passionate about what he teaches, but, he is not the best at lecturing. He is helpful if you ask more advanced questions after/outside class, but seems to teach to the LCD. Homework was hard at times and could take a while, but totally doable and great practice. Easy class overall (esp. exams), should've been harder.
